But when both types are present, the E. coli strain B is mostly affected, which suggests some kind of interaction or recombination between them. G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

The other half is diluted 1:10^5 and plated on strain K. Four plaques are found on K and 40 are found on B. Determine the amount of recombination between the two mutationsin this region of the T_4 genome.

A. 1 percent

B. 2 percent

C. 1.5 percent

D. 0.1 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

E. 0.2 percent

F. 0.3 percent

G. 0.5 percent

H. 5 percent

I. 0.02 percent

J. 0.05 percent

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
